meanings.definition: The state or quality of being neutral.
meanings.sent1: Her neutralness in the argument helped to calm the situation.
meanings.sent2: The judge's neutralness in the case ensured a fair trial for all.
meanings.sent3: The neutralness of the cat in choosing between two identical toys was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The neutralness of the gray sky made the colorful flowers stand out even more.
meanings.sent5: The neutralness of the paint color made it easy to match with any furniture.

meanings.definition: The tendency to remain impartial or unbiased.
meanings.sent1: His neutralness in the conflict resolution process was highly valued.
meanings.sent2: Journalists strive for neutralness in their reporting to present all sides fairly.
meanings.sent3: The neutralness of the referee in the game made both teams trust his decisions.
meanings.sent4: The neutralness of the scale ensured accurate measurements every time.
meanings.sent5: The neutralness of the mediator helped the two parties reach a compromise.

meanings.definition: The lack of distinctive characteristics or qualities.
meanings.sent1: The neutralness of the background allowed the subject to stand out in the photo.
meanings.sent2: The neutralness of the packaging made it suitable for a wide range of products.
meanings.sent3: The neutralness of the music in the elevator was oddly entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The neutralness of the landscape made it difficult to navigate without landmarks.
meanings.sent5: The neutralness of the outfit made it perfect for any occasion.
